org.safs.tools

Class GenericProcessMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.safs.tools.GenericProcessMonitor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ProcessMonitor

    public class GenericProcessMonitor
extends java.lang.Object
    Various utilities for monitoring or otherwise interrogating native system processes. This "Generic" version does all logging to System.out

    Subclasses should override the debug(String) method to log to alternative mechanisms and should override the

    This class contains no extended SAFS dependencies and can be readily packaged and distributed for non-SAFS installations.

    • Method Detail

      • deduceOSFamily

        protected static java.lang.String deduceOSFamily()
        Deduce the 'OS family name' from the 'OS name'.
        'windows' for all versions of Windows System.
        'unix' for all versions of Unix, Linux System.
        'mac' for all versions of Mac System.
        Returns:
        "windows", "unix" or "mac"
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if neither can be deduced.

      • debug

        protected static void debug(java.lang.String message)
        Writes to System.out . Subclasses should override to log to alternate sinks.
        Parameters:
        message -

      • getProcessCapture

        protected static GenericProcessCapture getProcessCapture(java.lang.Process aproc)
        Subclasses may wish to override to return a different subclass of GenericProcessCapture.
        Parameters:
        aproc -
        Returns:

      • isProcessRunning

        public static boolean isProcessRunning(java.lang.String procid)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Return true or false that a given process is running on the system. On Windows we are using the output for comparison. On Unix we are using output for comparison.
        Parameters:
        procid - CMD name, or IMAGE, or PID to seek.
        Returns:
        true if the procid is running/listed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any error occurs in getting the processes for evaluation.

      • shutdownProcess

        public static boolean shutdownProcess(java.lang.String procid)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Attempt to forcefully kill a given process by name or PID. On Windows we are using taskkill.exe. On Unix we are using kill -9 for PID, or killall for process names. Of course, this must be used with care!
        Parameters:
        procid - CMD name(nix ps-f) or IMAGE(win qprocess.exe) or PID to kill.
        Returns:
        true if the shutdown attempt returned with success, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if no shutdown attempt was ever able to execute.
